lines.text: Try not to die like a dog.
Smile!
For what? There's nothing to smile about!
You don't have to have a reason. Just do it.
But there's nothing to smile about.
What do you think is the most successful animal that's ever lived on this earth?
The ant?

science. Technology is a survival kit of the human race. Even the politicians realize this. What they don't, or won't realize is, that the technical solutions are already entirely within our power. The entire population of India could be rehoused on the moon within ten years. It's only a matter of learning to live in a new way.
Always remember gentlemen, that you are a failure in catering if you don't know what to do with your leftovers.
Remember the words of William Blake - "A sincere wish that anything is so, will make it so."
Michael, I don't know if anyone's ever told you this, but you happen to belong to a very rare group of encephaloids.

[talking about game of chess]
If you don't take that castle soon, the National Trust will!
Professor Stewart was too far in advance of his time, but his name will live long. We will stand in silence, in grateful memory for fifteen seconds.

[graffiti]
Revolution is the opium of the intellectuals.
The future is in your hands, Mr. Travis. Take it... now!

[referring to an on-stage sex-act performance]
Chocolate sandwich! Chocolate sandwich! Chocolate sandwich! Chocolate sandwich!
Beware of Mrs. Ball's treacle tart. There is many-a-fly that got stuck in that!
Would you like some soup, sir?
No thanks, son. I don't take solids.

[Chatting up factory girl]
Do you realize this Nigerian coffee is being packed straight back to Nigeria?
Come on, Streaky, aggravate the gravel!

[to secretary]
Miss Hunter, two Valium and a barley wine for Professor Stewart.
Daddy owns so much that he rarely misses anything.
You're lucky. I've got to get there on my own.
And where?
Right to the top!
[pause. Then, pointing to a skycraper in the distance]
How much a building like that is worth?
The ground floor is £810,000 a year, it costed ten times that to build, and every three months its value increases by 20%.

[Smiling patronizingly]
How do you know?

[With assurance]
My father owns it.

[to colleague]
Travis - that's your man.
Yes, but what's gonna happen to me? Will I come out the same as I went in?
better.
Now, I would just like you to sign this release form.

[reads from the form]
"I hereby consent to lease the Millar Research Clinic all physical experimental rights in my body for one week for the sum of £100." Well, I'd like to help Professor Millar, but £150 is definitely my minimum price.
Definitely? A figure like that is just beyond us.
One hundred and fifty pounds... and I'm not going to argue about it.
A hundred and thirty.
A hundred and forty-five.
A hundred and thirty-five.
A hundred and forty.
Done! Sign by the cross.

[Title song]
If you've found the reason to live on,/and not to die,/you are a lucky man.
The dividing line between the House of Lords and Pentonville Jail is very, very thin.
Dickie. Ha-ha.
Please, darling. Please.
Dickie.
But, you must.
Oh, don't go on, Dickie.
I've nev-never been very sure of myself. Not, until I found you.
You drink too much.
I know. You're my last chance.
Oh, little Dickie.

I've sensed the spark of idealism in you and I can move mountains, you know that, hmm. Oh, for a man like you, Travis. Michael, for a boy like you, you're still young! Everything is possible. The world is your oyster. I can see you stripped, building motorways. You have eyes like Steve McQueen. Did anyone ever tell you that?
It may not be as easy as you think.
What is it?
Om. It means infinity or godhead.
Are you a buddhist?
All religion's are equally true.
[Kiss]
Breakfast!
